lines: Hey, buddy? How are you doing? You look pretty rough, {my friend}[Person, Best Friend]. I never expected to see you like this. Things really do change in the blink of an eye, huh. Locked in? More like locked in this room, am I right. Haha. <He laughs, awkwardly.>

Not much has happened in the past week, as far as I know. Last time I saw you was right before the crash, at the church. I’m still not sure what {Father Neal}[person, Father Neal] was thinking, picking you to lead the Sunday service. {Your dad}[person, Dad] always does it, it doesn't make much sense to suddenly drop it onto you.
Perhaps, as the high priest, your dad could have been trying to give you the opportunity to practice leading the congregation? We know he saw you as his successor.
The thing is, did he consider what effect it would have on you, if he placed all these expectations on you? Not everyone is as zealous as him…

My bad. I didn’t mean to trash talk your family. I know we don’t mess with this whole congregation thing any more than we have to, but desperate times call for desperate measures. If {Father Neal}[person, Father Neal] promises a miracle, like he always does, maybe, just maybe, it will work.
I’ll try and find time to visit again, alright? See you later.
<The door swings open. {Your friend}[Person, Best Friend] walks in.> Okay, don’t freak out... I stole something from my dad.
<Stepping inside, he drops his bag next to the bed, then kicks the door shut with their foot and drops into the chair.> I brought you something.
<They dig through their bag. Items falling out left and right. Snack wrappers. A pencil. A crumpled worksheet, etc.> Hold on- Just a moment... Ah!

<They pull out a {slightly scuffed baseball}[Item, Signed Baseball], covered in messy Sharpie signatures, and toss it gently onto your blanket.> You remember this? It’s that baseball on my dad's office shelf! Cool, right? I’ve always wanted to have a closer look. <He holds it up to your eyes and spins it around for you to see.> I remember how bad you wanted it. Well, it’s all yours now. It’s better than letting it collect dust on the shelf.
<Whispering>, Just be sure not to tell anyone…
<Out of the corner of your eyes, you see {Your friend}[Person, Best Friend] walk into the room with something in his hand.>

Hi there, friend. I finally got free time to visit you again. I was walking down the isles in the market when I saw this. <He holds up a little {figurine of a boat}[Item, Souvenir].>
You like boating, I think? I found this nice figurine that might make this room a little more lively. I’ll just put it on your window sill, alright?
<You don’t really care about boats, but you do care about your friend. Proof that he still cares about you too is enough of a gift.>
<It is late in the afternoon when {your friend}[Person, Best Friend] dashes into the room.>

How are you feeling today, buddy? I hope it isn’t too painful… Well, I’m sure it doesn’t feel good when you aren’t able to do anything, what am I saying. Anyway, I came here right after my job was done, and look what I got for you: a {Get-well-soon card}[Item, Friend’s Card] with googly eyes on it!

<He holds up the card in front of your eyes and shakes it, allowing you to see the swirling little eyes.>
Doesn’t it look funny? I hope that card can make your day a little less boring. Remember, me and your family are all eager for you to get better! Don’t lose {hope}[Feeling, Hope], okay?
I know you are strong enough to pull through this. I’ll leave {the card}[Item, Friend’s Card] here.
The card reminded you of all the ups and downs that you overcame with the support of your friend. A symbol of love and trust, you felt much more hopeful by just knowing the card is still there.
Damn, I’m not even sure if you are hearing me or not… <He places the card by your bedside and leaves with a saddened face.>
